data.meta_description: Find what's on and events in Edinburgh during July 2024
data.text:
The Late Show @ The Comedy Attic

Selected dates between 30th June 2023 - 31st December 2024

Join us in the wee hours in The Comedy Attic in Edinburgh, where every weekend we deliver nights packed full of unadulterated comedy mayhem!

READ MORE

Photography Tuition in Edinburgh’s Old Town

1st November 2023 - 1st November 2024

Edinburgh Old Town

Learn to use your camera in one of the most beautiful cities in the world from a working photographer and film maker! Perfect for solo travellers, couples and families.

READ MORE

Rosslyn Chapel & Scottish Antiquaries Exhibition

9th November 2023 - 1st October 2024

Historic Environment Scotland Archives acquired the Rosslyn Album in 2021 and this exhibition presents images from the archive collections relating to Rosslyn Chapel and the contents of the album.

READ MORE

Edinburgh Opera Company Seeking New Singers For Carmen

20th November 2023 - 18th August 2024

Aria Alba is looking for new members to join our exciting production of Georges Bizet's Carmen at the Edinburgh Fringe in August 2024.

READ MORE

Live music at Bar 13

30th November 2023 - 30th November 2024

Join us early evening at Bar 13 for live music every Thursday, Friday and Saturday with Rory & The Island!

READ MORE

Daily Tours at St Giles’ Cathedral

10th December 2023 - 1st December 2024

Join a volunteer guide for a 45 min to 1 hour glimpse into the history, heraldry and life of our historic Cathedral and Thistle Chapel!

READ MORE

Escape the Past: The Anatomist

1st January 2024 - 31st December 2024

Descend into a world of grave robbery, mystery and malpractice as you embark on a thrilling adventure into Edinburgh’s dark past.

READ MORE

Grassmarket Market

Selected dates between 1st January 2024 - 28th December 2024

Every Saturday the centre of the Grassmarket becomes a flurry of excitement with the arrival of the weekly market, home to art, crafts, jewellery, gifts, not to mention amazing locally made food!

READ MORE

Stockbridge Market

Selected dates between 1st January 2024 - 22nd December 2024

The weekly Stockbridge Market is a foodie heaven featuring creative crafts, original artwork, superb street food. Eat, meet, greet or treat - there is something for everyone!

READ MORE

Stand Up Horror

Selected dates between 6th January 2024 - 19th October 2024

Actor, writer and tour guide Alex Staniforth invents a horror story every night. You decide what the characters do, find and sometimes - yes sometimes - even love!

READ MORE

Live Music

7th January 2024 - 31st July 2024

Come and enjoy all your favourite singalongs and some of Scotland's best musical talents at The Three Sisters Edinburgh!

READ MORE

Edinburgh ‘Open House’ Ceilidhs

19th January 2024 - 20th December 2024

Join Edinburgh ‘Open House’ Ceilidhs for their Friday Ceilidhs held in the Royal British Legion Hall! If you love to dance or want to learn this event is for you.

READ MORE

Spandex Comedy

Selected dates between 23rd January 2024 - 30th July 2024

Don't miss out on Spandex Comedy! Join us every Tuesday night for a top night of laughs featuring stand up comedians from across the country dropping in to liven up the start of your week!

READ MORE

Open Mic Night

Selected dates between 31st January 2024 - 31st July 2024

Join host Michael Dodds every Wednesday at The Three Sisters for an evening of music, singing, poetry, comedy and much more!

READ MORE

Scotland’s Gardens Scheme Open Garden: Shepherd House

6th February 2024 - 25th July 2024

Musselburgh

Visit Shepherd House, a constantly evolving artist’s garden that never stands still, with lots of surprises including a shell house built in 2014, lavender parterres, a rill and fountains!

READ MORE

The Bad Boy Pub Quiz

Selected dates between 6th February 2024 - 30th July 2024

Join us at The Three Sisters Edinburgh for the Bad Boy Pub Quiz on a Tuesday at 8pm in our Main Bar!

READ MORE

The Crafters Roadshow - The Centre Livingston

Selected dates between 8th February 2024 - 20th October 2024

Shop from the best in Scottish Crafts and support your local makers when The Crafters Roadshow comes to The Centre Livingston!

READ MORE

FULL MOON with Transmission Meditation 2024

Selected dates between 24th February 2024 - 15th December 2024

Join Share International Scotland for a powerful group meditation and work of planetary service at the time of the full moon each month!

READ MORE

Paranormal Illusionist: Ghosts of the Banshee

Selected dates between 2nd March 2024 - 7th December 2024

Are you brave enough to attend an unsettling night of magic and ghosts in the Banshee Labyrinth - Scotland's Most Haunted Pub - built into the legendary South Bridge Vaults.

READ MORE

Maps: Memories from the Second World War

9th March 2024 - 26th January 2025

Through personal stories, photography and memorabilia, this exhibition at the National War Museum charts the creation and use of maps during the Second World War.

READ MORE

Scotland’s Gardens Scheme Open Garden: Humbie Dean

Selected dates between 20th March 2024 - 2nd October 2024

Various Locations East Lothian

Come and visit Humbie Dean, a two-acre ornamental and woodland garden sandwiched between two burns at 600 feet with interest throughout a long season!

READ MORE

The Cabaret of Dangerous Ideas

Selected dates between 20th March 2024 - 23rd July 2024

Take two top academics, some dangerous ideas, add one comedian and you have the force of nature that is the Cabaret of Dangerous Ideas (CODI)!

READ MORE

Comedy At Canon’s Gait

Selected dates between 21st March 2024 - 22nd August 2024

Get ready for a rib-tickling night of laughter with "The Good, The Bad and The Irish," a weekly comedy showcase hosted by the hilarious Michael Porter every Thursday at The Canons Gait.

READ MORE

Treasures of the National Library of Scotland

30th March 2024 - 30th April 2025

The National Library of Scotland's permanent exhibition provides a unique insight into Scotland’s history, culture and people and its place in the world.

READ MORE

Castle Street Market

1st April 2024 - 13th October 2024

Edinburgh New Town

Held in brightly coloured gazebos in the heart of central Edinburgh, Castle Street Market is filled with top quality products and has something to satisfy every taste!

READ MORE

Davidson’s Mains Health Walk

Selected dates between 1st April 2024 - 16th December 2024

Edinburgh West

Join Chest, Heart and Stroke Scotland’s Walking for Health Project for this free weekly walk in Davidson’s Mains! It's a low level, inclusive health walk open to everyone!

READ MORE

Scotland’s Gardens Scheme Open Garden: Stobshiel House

3rd April 2024 - 25th September 2024

Various Locations East Lothian

The garden at Stobshiel House is effectively split into four main parts and The extensive collection of shrubs and mature trees offer a fantastic backdrop during all seasons.

READ MORE

Scotland’s Gardens Scheme Open Garden: A Blackbird Sings

Selected dates between 13th April 2024 - 17th August 2024

Longniddry

This long garden in a corner site of Glassel Park Estate is planted mostly by plant type with water features and an unheated conservatory contains cacti and insectivorous plants.

READ MORE

Arthur’s Secrets

16th April 2024 - 26th September 2024

Come along on a guided walk to learn more about Arthur's Seat's turbulent past, created by fire and ice!

READ MORE

Newhailes Market

Selected dates between 20th April 2024 - 22nd December 2024

Come along to Newhailes monthly market where you'll find a fine selection of handmade goods; from jams and chutneys to pies and candles!

READ MORE

Pedal Power: Cycling and Activism in Edinburgh

27th April 2024 - 22nd September 2024

This exhibition at Museum of Edinburgh has been created by groups in Edinburgh who are campaigning to make our city a safe place for cycling.

READ MORE

Cab-arette Showtour

1st May 2024 - 31st December 2024

Various Locations Edinburgh

Enjoy a unique comedy musical Showtour in a taxi... be driven around Edinburgh, whilst entertained by Lola and her variety of characters!

READ MORE

Comedy At Canon’s Gait

Selected dates between 1st May 2024 - 25th August 2024

Don't miss out on the uproarious experience that has Edinburgh and beyond rolling in laughter at The Canon's Gait!

READ MORE

Free Book Club at Fort Kinnaird

Selected dates between 1st May 2024 - 28th November 2024

Fort Kinnaird is hosting a free monthly book club in partnership with Musselburgh Library to bring the community together over the joy of reading.

READ MORE

Edinburgh Rising from the Ashes: 200 Years of the Scottish Fire Service

3rd May 2024 - 22nd September 2024

Journey through two centuries of firefighting legacy with our special exhibition created in partnership with the Museum of Scottish Fire Heritage.

READ MORE

Beginner’s Sewing Class

Selected dates between 4th May 2024 - 27th July 2024

Spend a full day in the sewing studio and learn how to use a sewing machine and make a cushion cover with your new sewing skills!

READ MORE

The Comedy Cellar - Edinburgh

Selected dates between 10th May 2024 - 23rd August 2024

Get ready for a rib-tickling night of laughter with "The Good, The Bad and The Irish," a comedy showcase hosted by the hilarious Michael Porter every Friday at The Canon's Gait!

READ MORE

BMX Lessons

Selected dates between 11th May 2024 - 12th November 2024

Leith

The Scottish BMX School is offering BMX lessons for kids of all ages, currently being held at Victoria Park in Leith.

READ MORE

Edinburgh Food Tour

11th May 2024 - 29th November 2024

Edinburgh Old Town

Eat and drink your way through Scotland’s history and culture on a carefully curated wander through the cobbled streets and historic alleys of Edinburgh.

READ MORE

Evening Sunset Jazz Cruise

Selected dates between 25th May 2024 - 17th August 2024

Join us for a magical evening on the river Forth with our legendary Jazz cruise featuring live music from the "Maid of the Forth Stompers"!

READ MORE

Ghosts - Tales of Terror at Lauriston Castle

Selected dates between 25th May 2024 - 28th September 2024

Come along and see the sights of Lauriston Castle as never seen before – hear the history of the castle and ghostly tales of the city!

READ MORE

The Edinburgh Sketcher Returns to Lauriston Castle

Selected dates between 30th May 2024 - 18th August 2024

Edinburgh’s favourite sketcher makes a welcome return to Lauriston Castle and we are teaming up with him once again for some sketching workshops.

READ MORE

Ramsay & Edinburgh Fashion

7th June 2024 - 24th November 2024

A collection of Allan Ramsay’s portraits of women from NTS properties are brought together at the Georgian House for the first time.

READ MORE

Japanese language for kids age 6 -13

8th June 2024 - 27th July 2024

This is a special chance in Edinburgh for kids (Age 6 - 13) to learn Japanese language, crafts, food, art, and culture from a qualified Japanese teacher.

READ MORE

Arthur’s Evening Walk

9th June 2024 - 25th August 2024

Enjoy an evening stroll around Holyrood Park as you join our Rangers to learn more about Arthur’s Seat’s turbulent past, created by fire and ice!

READ MORE

The Karaoke Crawl

Selected dates between 9th June 2024 - 1st September 2024

Whether you're a seasoned karaoke pro or a first-time singer, The Karaoke Crawl welcomes everyone who's ready to let loose and have a great time.

READ MORE

Learn French - Small Group Classes in Brunstfield

10th June 2024 - 22nd July 2024

Join Bonjour French Classes and give yourself a real chance of learning French properly! It's a new French course for 5 levels (beginners to advanced) held in La Barantine, Bruntsfield.

READ MORE

Ghost Stories on The Royal Mile

Selected dates between 13th June 2024 - 15th July 2024

This summer, join John Tantalon in the confines of the legendary Waverley Bar, just off The Royal Mile for two evenings of ghostly tales!

READ MORE

Watch UEFA EURO 2024 at Roxy Lanes

14th June 2024 - 14th July 2024

Roxy Lanes Edinburgh, the home of ‘Booze & Ball Games’, will be showcasing all the UEFA EURO games this year, to commemorate this summer’s football centrepiece!

READ MORE

Wildlife Printmaking Exhibition

15th June 2024 - 28th July 2024

This exhibition at the Scottish Ornithologists Club presents the work of 4 printmakers inspired by wildlife and working with different printmaking techniques.

READ MORE

Scotland’s Gardens Scheme Open Garden: Claremont

Selected dates between 16th June 2024 - 4th August 2024

Whitburn

Claremont is an eclectic garden created over the past 18 years. There are three ponds (one very large), a rockery, a dovecot, rose patio and a few interesting trees including a grand monkey puzzle.

READ MORE

Free Silver Valuations

Selected dates between 27th June 2024 - 28th November 2024

Come along and meet Lyon & Turnbull's silver specialist, Kier Mulholland to find out if you have a future auction highlight in your home.

READ MORE

Once Upon a Time: A History of Children and Young People’s Nursing exhibition

27th June 2024 - 24th October 2024

This exhibition at the Royal College of Nursing explores the history of children and young people's nursing from the first children's hospitals in the 1800s to the development of family-centred care.

READ MORE

Moyna Flannigan: Space Shuffle

28th June 2024 - 15th September 2024

In our 40th year, Collective is delighted to welcome back renowned Scottish artist, and early committee member Moyna Flannigan to present an exhibition of new work.

READ MORE

RSPB Scotland at Lauriston Castle

Selected dates between 28th June 2024 - 20th July 2024

Come and visit the RSPB stand at Lauriston Castle to find out how we are giving nature a home and how you can get involved.

READ MORE

Coorie Cafe at One Dalkeith

Selected dates between 29th June 2024 - 10th August 2024

Come and join us at The Coorie Cafe at One Dalkeith, where good food and the community meet in the heart of Dalkeith.

READ MORE

Emily Powell: The Land Below the Waves

29th June 2024 - 13th July 2024

Morningside Gallery is hosting a new solo exhibition from artist Emily Powell, following her painting residency on the isle of Tiree.

READ MORE

Game On

29th June 2024 - 3rd November 2024

Get set for Game On - the largest interactive exhibition of the history and the culture of video games.

READ MORE

Knit & Natter

Selected dates between 29th June 2024 - 10th August 2024

Are you someone who loves to knit, crochet or cross stitch? Join us in The Coorie Café at One Dalkeith on Saturdays!

READ MORE

Summer Days at The Royal Yacht Britannia

29th June 2024 - 30th August 2024

Fun for all the family, explore the five decks of The Royal Yacht Britannia this summer, it's Tripadvisor’s No. 1 UK Attraction!

READ MORE

Macmillan Cancer Information and Support Drop-in

1st July 2024 - 23rd December 2024

Various Locations Edinburgh

Every week at various Libraries, trained Macmillan Volunteers offer a friendly listening ear to anyone affected by cancer, including those with a cancer diagnosis, as well as family and friends.

READ MORE

The Dark Side of Edinburgh

1st July 2024 - 1st September 2024

Edinburgh Old Town

The Dark Side of Edinburgh is a historic tour of the city that doesn't leave out all the gory details. Are brave enough to learn the truth?

READ MORE

The Wild Outdoors Summer Camps - St George’s School

1st July 2024 - 23rd July 2024

Edinburgh West

Discover the magic of summer at The Wild Outdoors Camps nestled in the breathtaking grounds of St. Georges School! For children ages 5-11 Years.

READ MORE

Summer Exhibition at Leith Makers

3rd July 2024 - 21st July 2024

Come along to Leith Makers Summer Exhibition in July with it's richly diverse preview exhibition of original and locally hand-made work by resident artists!

READ MORE

Neuk Perspectives

4th July 2024 - 28th July 2024

Join us for a captivating exhibition featuring the diverse talents of 41 neurodivergent artists from across Scotland, brought to you by Neuk Collective in July!

READ MORE

Elements

6th July 2024 - 31st July 2024

&Gallery is delighted to present a group exhibition featuring the work of three artists who are known for their minimal aesthetic: Jonathan Barber, David Quinn and Adam Taylor.

READ MORE

Medical History Tours

Selected dates between 6th July 2024 - 27th July 2024

Explore some key moments in history that defined medicine, all of which happened in or around Mary King's Close, during our Medical History Tour!

READ MORE

Summer Printmaking Courses

6th July 2024 - 19th August 2024

Edinburgh Printmakers have a range of courses this summer taking place over 3 or 4 days, including screenprinting, etching, relief printing, and the protected heritage craft of stone lithography.

READ MORE

Family Fun Summer Crafts

Selected dates between 8th July 2024 - 29th July 2024

Free Family Fun Summer Crafts from Parental Employability Support Midlothian. Come along and meet us at IKEA on Mondays from the 8th July.

READ MORE

Hands On History

Selected dates between 8th July 2024 - 26th August 2024

Join us in the Family Room at The Palace of Holyroodhouse to get up close to some historical and replica objects.

READ MORE

Summer Art Camp

8th July 2024 - 26th July 2024

Join Little Plaza in our cafe space while your kids are engaged in summer camp and other single sessions in the summer! Suitable for P2 - P7 kids.

READ MORE

Summer Outdoor Club

8th July 2024 - 2nd August 2024

Dynamic Earth’s Summer Outdoor Club is back. Join us for a week of fun and adventure in Holyrood Park, perfect for kids aged between 7 to 12 who love being outdoors and exploring the natural world!

READ MORE

The Things You Forgot to Imagine

8th July 2024 - 16th August 2024

Leith

‘The Things You Forgot to Imagine’ is Joanne Pemberton’s newest body of work and will be showing at Leith School of Art from 8th July.

READ MORE

Summer Woodland Explorers

9th July 2024 - 8th August 2024

Pack your child off to join us for a full immersion into Jupiter Artland’s magical landscape! it's a full day of creative activities and adventurous play.

READ MORE

Teddy Bears Picnic

Selected dates between 9th July 2024 - 25th July 2024

Join us in the customer restaurant as we Celebrate National Picnic month with a very special visit from Bjorn the Bear!

READ MORE

Genesis Scottish Open

10th July 2024 - 14th July 2024

North Berwick

The Genesis Scottish Open will return to The Renaissance Club as the best players from the DP World Tour and PGA TOUR tee it up from 10th to 14th July 2024.

READ MORE

Midweek makes: Collage crowns

Selected dates between 10th July 2024 - 28th August 2024

Join us in the Family Room at The Palace of Holyroodhouse to discover the stories behind some special crowns. Get creative by decorating your own crown to wear as you visit the rest of the Palace.

READ MORE

Withnail and I Photography Exhibition

10th July 2024 - 7th August 2024

Murray Close is one of the most prominent and successful film stills photographers working today. This is a chance to see photographs from one of the greatest British films 'Withnail and I'.

READ MORE

Edinburgh Jazz & Blues Festival

12th July 2024 - 21st July 2024

Various Locations Edinburgh

The Edinburgh Jazz & Blues Festival returns from 12th to 21st July 2024, presenting a programme that spans the entire history of the music from ragtime to modern jazz to Chicago blues and beyond.

READ MORE

Sprint World Orienteering Championships

12th July 2024 - 16th July 2024

Various Locations Edinburgh

Ahead of what is set to be an exciting summer of sport in Scotland, Edinburgh plays host to the Sprint World Orienteering Championships (WOC 2024) from 12-16 July.

READ MORE

Charity Afternoon tea

13th July 2024

Come along and support Steps To Hope SCIO, a local charity for those suffering from homelessness and addiction, at their fabulous charity afternoon tea at St Cuthbert's on 13th July!

READ MORE

Cirque - The Greatest Show

13th July 2024

Welcome to Cirque: the award-winning, smash-hit circus musical that is fun for all the family. Escape the ordinary and enter the world of the extraordinary!

READ MORE

Cold War Scotland

13th July 2024 - 26th January 2025

Exploring Scotland’s critical position on the frontline of the Cold War, a new exhibition will tell the stories of the Scots at the centre of this global conflict.

READ MORE

Darnell Cole and the Vibe - A Man of Soul

13th July 2024

Heading over the pond this Summer we welcome Darnell Cole and the Vibe to play at Scotland's longest running rock Club - Dreadnought Rock!

READ MORE

Girls Overheard

13th July 2024

Get ready to eavesdrop on the juiciest conversations from Glasgow's own Eilidh Wells, Lauren Kerr, and Ash Reid in 'Girls Overheard' at the Assembly Rooms on Saturday 13th July!

READ MORE

The Blackheart Market Edinburgh

13th July 2024

The Blackheart Market debuts in Edinburgh when it takes over The Out of the Blue Drill Hall on Saturday 13th July!

READ MORE

From Versailles to Charlotte Square

14th July 2024

Join us on Bastille Day for an evening exploring the tumultuous lives of the French Royal family, from glitter and glamour to relative obscurity as inhabitants of Edinburgh’s Charlotte Square!

READ MORE

Harry Potter & the Philosopher’s Stone In Concert with the RSNO

14th July 2024

The Royal Scottish National Orchestra will perform Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone in Concert on Sunday 14th July in the spectacular setting of Edinburgh Castle!

READ MORE

Scottish Festival of Motoring

14th July 2024

The Scottish Festival of Motoring returns to the Royal Highland Centre Edinburgh on Sunday 14th July 2024, it's a must go event for all the family!

READ MORE

Edinburgh Premiere: Where Olive Trees Weep

15th July 2024

Join Edinburgh Action For Palestine for a free screening of this important documentary. A searing window into the struggles & resilience of the Palestinian people under Israeli occupation.

READ MORE

Games & Gadgets with Maths Week Scotland

Selected dates between 15th July 2024 - 19th July 2024

Get your gadgets moving as Maths Week Scotland takes over the Grand Gallery for two days of the National Museum of Scotland's Summer Family Fun programme.

READ MORE

The Wild Outdoors Summer Camps - Fettes College

15th July 2024 - 6th August 2024

Edinburgh North

Come join The Wild Outdoors for some fun this Summer. With activities such as mastering bushcraft skills to conquering ninja lines, archery, and tomahawk throwing!

READ MORE

The Wild Outdoors Summer Camps - Colinton Road

15th July 2024 - 30th July 2024

Edinburgh South

Come join The Wild Outdoors for some fun this Summer, filled with excitement, learning, and lifelong memories for children ages 5-11 Years.

READ MORE

An Evening with: Ed Winters

16th July 2024

Join us at Waterstones Edinburgh West End on Tuesday 16th July to hear Ed Winter's, activist and author of This is Vegan Propaganda talk about his latest book, How to Argue with a Meat Eater.

READ MORE

Free Asian Art Valuations

Selected dates between 16th July 2024 - 24th September 2024

Make an appointment to meet the Lyon & Turnbull's Asian Art team to find out if you have a future auction highlight in your collection!

READ MORE

Michael Flatley’s Lord of the Dance

16th July 2024 - 18th July 2024

After celebrating the 25th anniversary of Lord of the Dance in 2022, Michael Flatley is back with a dazzling revival of his iconic dance extravaganza. Catch it at Edinburgh Playhouse in July!

READ MORE

Beginners Intensive Sewing Course

17th July 2024 - 19th July 2024

This beginners intensive sewing course run by Artisan Stitch will teach you all the foundation skills to launch you into the world of sewing.

READ MORE

Botanical Bookbinding - Day Workshop

17th July 2024

Leith

Join Cass, of Bookbinding with Cass, for a creative day of mark making and bookbinding inspired by local flora and fauna on 17th July at INK on MESH!

READ MORE

Evening Sound Immersion

Selected dates between 17th July 2024 - 28th August 2024

Come and join the the Universal School of Holistic Therapies for 90 minutes of complete relaxation, sound immersion, meditation and reiki at the Out of the Blue Drill Hall.

READ MORE

Mark Hearld at Dovecot: In Conversation

17th July 2024

Come along and meet Meet artist Mark Hearld on 17th July, while he undertakes the last few days of his residency at Dovecot Studios!

READ MORE

Quiz Night!

Selected dates between 17th July 2024 - 21st August 2024

Join us in our customer restaurant at IKEA Edinburgh on the third Wednesday of the month for our new quiz night with fun IKEA prizes.

READ MORE

Stuart McPherson: Work in Progress

17th July 2024

Don't miss this brand new hour of jokes from Stuart McPherson, the co-host of the Some Laugh podcast and Scot Squad star, ahead of this year's Fringe.

READ MORE

(Nearly) Full Moon Herb Walk & Tea Tasting

18th July 2024

Come and join Grass Roots Remedies Co-op on 18th July for the third in a new series of herbal workshops offered on and around the 100 acre Lauriston Agroecology Farm in North West Edinburgh.

READ MORE

Bitesize Bookbinding: Hemp Leaf Binding

18th July 2024

Leith

Join Cass, of Bookbinding with Cass, and create a hardcover hinged book with an intricate Japanese stab stitch – a nifty way of stitching single sheets together and a great book structure to master!

READ MORE

Courtyard Café with Roberta Hall-McCarron

18th July 2024

For one night only, join us for a truly unique dining experience in the heart of Edinburgh’s world-famed Royal Botanic Garden on Thursday 18th July!

READ MORE

Daring & Delicious - Private Walking Tour

18th July 2024 - 27th October 2024

Edinburgh Old Town

Come to wander through the secret alleyways of old Edinburgh - come to listen, come to share your own daring stories. This private tour is unmissable!

READ MORE

Date Night at Dovecot

18th July 2024

Thursday night is Date Night at Dovecot! Bring a friend, a partner, or enjoy a solo evening of live music, drinks, special programming, and tapestry.

READ MORE

Hearth Fire Sessions

18th July 2024

Join host Dougie Mackay as he invites a selection of Scotland’s finest storytellers, songwriters, musicians, and performing artists to the bi-monthly Hearth Fire Sessions on 18th July!

READ MORE

National Theatre Live: Nye

18th July 2024

The epic new Welsh fantasia Nye, which sees Michael Sheen playing Nye Bevan, will be broadcast live from the National Theatre on 18th July.

READ MORE

Out of The Blue - A Celebration of Joni Mitchell

18th July 2024

After repeated sell out shows, Anne Gair and her band are taking the show on the road in 2024 with a date at The Voodoo Rooms on 18th July!

READ MORE

The Quo Story

18th July 2024

The Quo Story, celebrating 60 years of "The No 1 Rock & Roll Band in the Land", comes to the Howden Park Centre on 18th July!

READ MORE

Wild & Tame: Animals in History Exhibition Launch

18th July 2024

Join us at the Royal College of Physicians of Edinburgh on 18th July to celebrate the launch of our exhibition 'Wild & Tame: Animals in History'.

READ MORE

A Cultural History of UFOs in Scotland

19th July 2024

Leaving aside extraordinary explanations for UFOs, this talk, at The Sir Arthur Conan Doyle Centre on 19th July, traces a history of Scottish UFOs from the 1950s to the 1990s.

READ MORE

Daring Women of Edinburgh - A Walking Tour of Our History

Selected dates between 19th July 2024 - 26th October 2024

Various Locations Edinburgh

Come on this walking tour and gain a unique insight into some of the daring women in Edinburgh's history!

READ MORE

Old Town Motown

19th July 2024

Join us for a night of Motown, Soul and Funk, right in the heart of Edinburgh's Old Town at La Belle Angele on 19th July!

READ MORE

Physic Garden Family Tours

Selected dates between 19th July 2024 - 2nd August 2024

For the first time, families will be able to join free short tours of the beautiful Physic Garden at the height of summer.

READ MORE

Sofar Live Music

19th July 2024

Get up close and personal with artists, meet like-minded music fans, and experience a cool, local space in an entirely new way at Leith Arches on 19th July!

READ MORE

The Polis

19th July 2024

Don't miss Scotland's number one Police tribute act, The Polis, when they return to The Voodoo Rooms this July!

READ MORE

A Date with the Everly Brothers

20th July 2024

Hear all the classic hits like Wake Up Little Susie, Cathy’s Clown and many more timeless songs when the UK's newest tribute to The Everly Brothers comes to the Howden Park Centre!

READ MORE

Dare to be Wild - Outdoor Workshop

Selected dates between 20th July 2024 - 19th October 2024

Various Locations Edinburgh

Do you dare to embrace your wild nature? Come to feel the incredible power of nature with Annabel Allen, your nature guide!

READ MORE

Eco-resin Tray - Terrazzo Craft Workshop

20th July 2024

Learn what's terrazzo and how to create your very own tray from start to finish at this workshop, run by Polymorphics on 20th July.

READ MORE

Inversion Yoga Workshop

20th July 2024

Have you ever wished you could easily take a headstand, handstand or arm balance in a yoga class? Then this all levels workshop on 20th July is for you!

READ MORE

Jemima Puddleduck at Lauriston Castle

20th July 2024

New for 2024, Quantum presents a delightful new adaptation of Beatrix Potter’s much-loved tale — The Tale of Jemima Puddle-Duck at Lauriston Castle on 20th July!

READ MORE

Kewdy de los santos el Gato Malo

20th July 2024

Kewdy De los Santos “El Gato Malo” it’s flying all the way to Leith Arches in Edinburgh to share stage with Robert Rufino and Liuven Dance.

READ MORE

Mark Nelson and Gareth Waugh - Fringe Preview Double Bill

20th July 2024

Join Mark Nelson and Gareth Waugh at The Stand Edinburgh as they try out new bits for their forthcoming shows at the Fringe.

READ MORE

Peppa Pig’s Fun Day Out
